mandate.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if a government or official has a mandate to make important decisions, they have the authority to make the decisions because they have been elected by the people to do so
mandate.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Sometimes a president thinks he has more of a mandate than he really does.
The president was elected with a clear mandate to tackle violent crime.
a popular mandate for election reform
I sought a mandate from my constituents to oppose this tax.
mandate.translation[0].definitions[1].de: an official instruction given to a person or organization, allowing them to do something
mandate.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Matters debated in meetings do not become a mandate automatically.
mandate.translation[0].definitions[2].de: the power given to one country to govern another country
mandate.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: The vote gave the trade union a clear mandate to pursue a better settlement.

mandate.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to tell someone that they must do a particular thing
mandate.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: These measures were mandated by the IMF.
